title: 請問have had/has had應該幾時同點用

replies.msg:
諗唔到究竟平時對話或者email可以點用
請問有冇簡單例子可以指教？

have had vs had
前者強調由一個時間點到present已經持續一段時間，
後者只係話俾你聽以前發生過，冇強調持續幾耐or specific time point

試下用warn做例子：

i have warned u.
我已經警告過你好L多次。
→強調自己持續一段時間已經一直警告你

i warned u.
我警告過你。
→冇強調幾多次，淨係表達「警告過」嘅意思

quote.msg:

前者強調由一個時間點到present已經持續一段時間，
後者只係話俾你聽以前發生過，冇強調持續幾耐or specific time point

試下用warn做例子：

i have warned u.
我已經警告過你好L多次。
→強調自己持續一段時間已經一直警告你

i warned u.
我警告過你。
→冇強調幾多次，淨係表達「警告過」嘅意思

replies.msg:
佢係講緊have had同has had
唔係講緊past tense同past perfect tense

後者只係話俾你聽以前發生過，冇強調持續幾耐or specific time point

→強調自己持續一段時間已經一直警告你

i warned u.
我警告過你。
→冇強調幾多次，淨係表達「警告過」嘅意思

佢係講緊have had同has had
唔係講緊past tense同past perfect tense

replies.msg: present perfect tense黎架喎

it's just for connecting a time period (present)


e.g I had a lot of assignments this week

(This sentence is simply telling someone that either I finished all the assignments / or this week is over )

e.g. I have had a lot of assignments this week

(You are telling people that you have a lot of work this work, and you might have more to come.
E.g. you can say this on Wednesday )

replies.msg:
Sorry我講得唔清楚 佢應該係想講PPT
但唔係兩者分別

唔該兩位，但係我都仲唔係好明
有冇多少少例子？

quote.msg:
it's just for connecting a time period (present)


e.g I had a lot of assignments this week

(This sentence is simply telling someone that either I finished all the assignments / or this week is over )

e.g. I have had a lot of assignments this week

(You are telling people that you have a lot of work this work, and you might have more to come.
E.g. you can say this on Wednesday )

replies.msg: 請問中文或者廣東話有冇咁嘅用法呢？

quote.msg:
唔該兩位，但係我都仲唔係好明
有冇多少少例子？

replies.msg:
唔洗諗到好複雜

首先have had/has had分別在於主語
I You We They -> Have
He She It -> Has

之後果個had其實係past perfect tense黎

I have had my lunch
我已經食左午餐

He has had the permission
佢已經有批准

試下加咗time point會唔會好啲？

i had mcdonalds for breakfast this morning.
我今朝食咗m記。

i have had mcdonalds for breakfast for weeks.
我食咗好幾個禮拜m記啦。

quote.msg:
it's just for connecting a time period (present)


e.g I had a lot of assignments this week

(This sentence is simply telling someone that either I finished all the assignments / or this week is over )

e.g. I have had a lot of assignments this week

(You are telling people that you have a lot of work this work, and you might have more to come.
E.g. you can say this on Wednesday )
請問中文或者廣東話有冇咁嘅用法呢？

replies.msg:
學英文唔好用廣東話諗
如果唔係好多位你都會諗唔明

一句嘅意思係強調件事可能until now仲未完 (e.g 如果開學禮校長話
hope you all have had a great summer holiday, 有機會有啲人仲未完）

一句係已經100%完
(老師同學生講 so now you all had your summer holiday... 已經完咗啦）

quote.msg:
試下加咗time point會唔會好啲？

i had mcdonalds for breakfast this morning.
我今朝食咗m記。

i have had mcdonalds for breakfast for weeks.
我食咗好幾個禮拜m記啦。

replies.msg:
你個例子同上面又有分別，你呢個係一段時間
上面就只係普通過去完成

想搭單問
Present prefect (have had) 同 simple past (had)
係咪好多時都可以互相交換用？ 文法上冇錯
但意思上有少許分別？

I have eaten lunch (強調已經食左 可能有人約我食lunch)
I ate lunch (單純話你知今日食左飯）

quote.msg:
it's just for connecting a time period (present)


e.g I had a lot of assignments this week

(This sentence is simply telling someone that either I finished all the assignments / or this week is over )

e.g. I have had a lot of assignments this week

(You are telling people that you have a lot of work this work, and you might have more to come.
E.g. you can say this on Wednesday )

學英文唔好用廣東話諗
如果唔係好多位你都會諗唔明

一句嘅意思係強調件事可能until now仲未完 (e.g 如果開學禮校長話
hope you all have had a great summer holiday, 有機會有啲人仲未完）

一句係已經100%完
(老師同學生講 so now you all had your summer holiday... 已經完咗啦）

it's just for connecting a time period (present)


e.g I had a lot of assignments this week

(This sentence is simply telling someone that either I finished all the assignments / or this week is over )

e.g. I have had a lot of assignments this week

(You are telling people that you have a lot of work this work, and you might have more to come.
E.g. you can say this on Wednesday )

replies.msg:
sorry有少少離題
如果第一句係用係this week over 咁點解唔係用last week
I had a lot of assignments last week

I had a take-home exam last year.
I have three assignments due next Monday.
I have already had so many assignments in the first few weeks of this new course.

- - -

2008 had a financial turmoil.
From 2006 to 2007, it had had numerous events leading up to the financial crisis in 2008.
2020 has had so many dramatic incidents.

quote.msg:
it's just for connecting a time period (present)


e.g I had a lot of assignments this week

(This sentence is simply telling someone that either I finished all the assignments / or this week is over )

e.g. I have had a lot of assignments this week

(You are telling people that you have a lot of work this work, and you might have more to come.
E.g. you can say this on Wednesday )

replies.msg: 第二句例句唔係錯咩?如果講specific既時間要用past tense

quote.msg:
it's just for connecting a time period (present)


e.g I had a lot of assignments this week

(This sentence is simply telling someone that either I finished all the assignments / or this week is over )

e.g. I have had a lot of assignments this week

(You are telling people that you have a lot of work this work, and you might have more to come.
E.g. you can say this on Wednesday )
第二句例句唔係錯咩?如果講specific既時間要用past tense

replies.msg:
第二句冇錯如果this week未完
如果今日係星期六，就可以用past tense
打字打到上手就會自動波. Also, I don’t really care.... as long as people understand

quote.msg:
想搭單問
Present prefect (have had) 同 simple past (had)
係咪好多時都可以互相交換用？ 文法上冇錯
但意思上有少許分別？

I have eaten lunch (強調已經食左 可能有人約我食lunch)
I ate lunch (單純話你知今日食左飯）

replies.msg:
多數唔可以互用 文法會錯
你嘅例子文法上無錯
但通常講食嘢唔會用eat lunch 會用have lunch

E.g. Do you wanna have lunch with us?
: I’ve had lunch already. / I’ve eaten just now.
(Present perfect)

E.g. What did you do during break time?
: I had lunch. / I ate.
(Past tense)
